intro: Eremophila battii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved emu bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Eremophila battii is often found in open woodlands and shrublands, thriving in full sun. Its flowers attract nectar-feeding birds and insects, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
